question: Question_04_(b)
sols:
To find $y''$ we simply need to differentiate the expression
$y' = -x^3/y^3$ from part (a). Using implicit differentiation and the
quotient rule, we have:

\begin{align*}
y'' &= \frac{-3x^2(y^3) - (-x^3)3y^2y'}{(y^3)^2} \\
&= \frac{3x^2y^2(-y + xy')}{y^6} \\
&= \frac{3x^2(-y + x y')}{y^4} \\
\end{align*}
hints:
Again, use implicit differentiation. You will need to use the quotient
rule as well.
